Effects of like/dislike?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Effects of like/dislike?
By B Campbell on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 10:00 am:

Okay, I did a pretty thourough search here and didn't find anything, so if this has already been discussed, my apologies.

We already know what effect liking/disliking food has on the monster. However, what about other likes? More specifically, what about when a monster shows like/dislike of a drill?

Does liking battle give your monster a greater stress reduction and better stat gains? Does liking rest make it more effective? I haven't found any evidence that liking a drill gives higher stat gains, so does it cause less stress/fatigue?

This seems like an important aspect that hasn't been looked into yet. I'm not sure how people got all the numbers for the various other aspects (such as items and foods) but it would be nice to know exactly what effects this had.

By hengers rock on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 02:05 pm:

liking/disliking battle seems to have a direct impact on the stat gains after battle, at the very least. both me and mepersoner have seen monsters that like battle get +15 and +16 after battle. monsters that dislike battle, I have seen them get +0 in a stat that wasn't maxxed. so, liking/disliking battle affects that, and I am not sure, but I think disliking battle either adds stress, or reduces far less than liking or even neutrality.
